result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:13 PM Defendant James H Kirk in court.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak appeared by video for James H Kirk.  Attorney Emily Nelson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. No agreement reached as of yet.  Atty requests a JT date.
Jury trial scheduled for March 24, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Final pre-trial on February 17, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Jury trial on March 24, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Review hearing on October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Review hearing on October 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:36 AM Defendant James H Kirk in court.  Attorney Annette Barna in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for James H Kirk. State calls Deputy Tyler Branstad, oath administered. 10:36AM Direct by the State. Witness has identified the defendant. 10:41am Cross by Defense. 10:45am Witness dismissed.  Argument by Defense, does not believe the burden has not been meet by the State. Response from the State. The court will find PC, will bind over for trial.  Unfiled information provided from the State to DE, will proceed to Arraignment.  Waive reading of the Information, enter a plea of NG to all counts.  Set for RH October 11, 2022 @ 2:00PM. Adj 10:50am.
Bond letter with sign bond enclosed for DE to sign and return.
No contact with MGG and EMH
